questions.text: A 28-year-old male brought an MRI of his left shoulder which showed avulsion of the anterior glenoid labrum. He had a complaint of recurrent episodes of anterior shoulder subluxation/dislocation. Name the lesion which is present on the posterolateral aspect of humeral head.

A 35-year-old male presented to causality after a car accident with complaints of pain in the right hip & inability to bear weight. On examination, he was unable to lift the right lower limb, & the limb appeared to be abducted & shortened with the foot’s lateral border touching the examination table. Clinical Diagnosis is:

A 35-year-old obese female presented to the OPD with complaint of pain on the lateral aspect of ankle following a twisting injury. On local examination, the treating physician found tenderness along the distal aspect of fibula. He splinted the ankle and got an x-ray of ankle done. Name the rule used to get the X-ray done for ankle trauma cases?
Shown below is an X-ray of a patient with history of a chronic knee pain. True statement concerning the X-ray shown would be:
questions.correct_answer: D. Bipartite patella; X-ray other knee
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Bipartite patella; X-ray other knee

questions.text: Correctly match the statement regarding the splint shown in image.

options.label: A
options.text: Knuckle bender splint; Ulnar Nerve Palsy

options.label: B
options.text: Dynamic cock up splint; Radial Nerve Palsy

options.label: C
options.text: Turn buckle splint; Volkmann’s Ischaemic Contracture

options.label: D
options.text: Knuckle bender splint; Median Nerve Palsy

questions.correct_answer: B. Dynamic cock up splint; Radial Nerve Palsy
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Dynamic cock up splint; Radial Nerve Palsy

questions.text: A 28-year-old epileptic patient had a fall on an outstretched hand. He presented to the OPD with complaints of inability to touch the opposite shoulder, pain & deformity on the right shoulder. On examination, the acromion process appeared to be prominent. What type of shoulder dislocation does the patient have?

A 13-year-old girl had a twisting injury 3 years ago. No bony injury on the left foot and ankle were noted in the x-ray back then. The patient frequently visited to the GP in the last 3 years for pain in the left lower leg which was intermittent till now and was managed conservatively. But now her pain has worsened and become continuous. It is not associated with fever. Laboratory reports came out to be normal. Fresh X-ray was ordered which showed lytic lesion in the lower leg as shown below in the image. On MRI, a lower leg abscess was seen. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 31-year-old female presented in the OPD with X-ray of the right hand showing well-defined, lucent, central, & medullary lesion in the proximal phalanx, associated with “Popcorn” stippling. Diagnosis is:

A 14-year-old female came to the OPD because of pain & swelling in the right upper arm, which was increasing. On local examination, the skin over the swelling was shiny, tenderness was positive, & there was decreased range of motion. On X-ray, there was medullary & cortical bone destruction, along with sunburst appearance. On biopsy, the heterogenic cut surface showed areas of haemorrhage, fibrosis & cystic degeneration; poorly formed trabecular bone with cellular pleomorphism & mitosis. Diagnosis is:

A 30-year-old male went to a quack for his hip pain after a fall from the bike but did not recovered fully. He then came to an Orthopaedic OPD with X-ray hip AP and Lateral views. The Surgeon advised internal fixation & bone grafting with biopsy, & the surgery was performed. On microscopic examination, trabecular bone was replaced by woven bone with a characteristic look of Chinese letter. What will be the Diagnosis & characteristic X-ray feature?

options.label: B
options.text: Ewing’s Sarcoma with Onion skin periosteal reaction

options.label: D
options.text: Fibrous Dysplasia with Ground glass appearance

questions.correct_answer: D. Fibrous Dysplasia with Ground glass appearance
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Fibrous Dysplasia with Ground glass appearance

questions.text: A 20-year-old male presented with paraparesis of bilateral lower limb and numbness following an intimal back pain for past 6 months. MRI of the lumbosacral spine showed a 4 cm enhancing soft tissue mass at L4-L5 vertebrae, extending into the spinal canal with compression of the thecal sac & lytic lesion at the spinous process of L4 vertebrae. On biopsy, a small-round-blue-cell neoplasm, staining for CD 199 & vimentin stain were seen. What condition is he suffering from?
In the previous scenario, the tumor present is _______?

A 13-year-old male presented with progressive left knee pain. Initially, the pain was only present on performing high impact activities, now it is present at rest & at night. On X-Ray of the knee, reactive bone around radiolucent nidus is seen in the proximal tibia. On CT scan, size of the nidus was < 1.5 cm. On biopsy, nidus contained immature woven bone with a sharp border of osteoblastic rimming. What is the diagnosis?

A 13-year-old male presented in the OPD with asymptomatic swelling on the right knee which is gradually increasing in size. On X-ray, a pedunculated mass on the distal femur is seen. After seeing the X-ray, the treating doctor advised clinical observation. What is the patient suffering from?

A 57-year-old man met with an RTA & got polytrauma with fracture of right shaft of femur and fracture of left shaft of tibia and was operated by an orthopaedic surgeon with nailing within 24 hours of injury. Patient was comfortable till 4th day of surgery when he became unresponsive. On evaluation, patient was unable to follow commands & there was no spontaneous eye opening. On examination, Temperature: 39.8° C Blood Pressure: 110/60 mmHg Respiratory Rate: 35/min Heart Rate: 125 bpm SpO 2 : Between 90-95% & was put on O 2 mask at 8 litre/min On laboratory investigation, Haemoglobin = 9 gm/dl Platelet count = 150/microliter The patient is diagnosed with:

A 28-year-old female met with an RTA and had an open fracture of the distal tibia with a wound size of 15 cm. She was brought to triage, where after resuscitation, the wound was washed thoroughly to remove the dirt. A necrotic and devitalized tissue was debrided and arthroplasty was done. This type of injury falls into which category of Gustilo-Anderson classification?

A 22-year-old boy presented to OPD with complaints of LBA & morning stiffness which improves with activity & increases on rest. On examination, there is limitation of chest wall expansion, presence of uveitis, Schober test positive. On lab investigation, HLA B27 is positive. On X-ray, Dagger Sign & Trolley Track Sign are present. Diagnosis is:

Two siblings of Indo-Aryan ethnicity, aged 5 and 8 years were admitted with irregular LGF & decreased vision and hearing. They also had a history of frequent fractures. On examination, they were found pale with poor nutritional status, short stature, bowing of long bones, & frontal bossing. On laboratory investigation, anaemia was seen. X-rays of the long bones showed bowing, increased cortical thickness, & bone-in-bone appearance. What condition do you think they are suffering from?

An 8-year-old boy presented with knock knees in the OPD, with complaints of generalised weakness & irritability. On examination, rachitic rosary of chest & pot belly is seen. On X-ray of the knees, physeal widening, & metaphyseal cupping & fraying are seen. The child is suffering from:

An 18-year-old male presented to the triage with complaints of ankle pain and fever. Upon history, patient was diagnosed with ankle sprain 3 weeks back by the treating doctor. This led to swelling which worsened during past week. On local examination at the triage, he has swelling in the ipsilateral knee, bleeding gums, diffuse perifollicular haemorrhages across the bilateral upper extremities. There has been a family history of bleeding on his maternal side. There was no clubbing of the nails but splinter haemorrhages on nails were seen. What will be the likely diagnosis & management in this case?

A 53-year-old male patient complained of inability to use his right ring finger freely. He is also experiencing locking episode of the finger. On examination, the table top test is positive. What is he suffering from?

A 44-year-old man presented with acute onset of low backache radiating to the right lower limb. Examination revealed SLRT<40° on the right side, weakness of extensor hallucis longus, sensory loss in the first web space of the right foot and brisk knee jerk. Which of the following is most likely the diagnosis?

A 25-year-old soccer player presented in the OPD with his knee X-ray. On careful examination of X-ray, an avulsed fragment of proximal lateral tibia is seen. Most sensitive test to diagnose the condition is:
Fracture at which site in leg will cause failure of dorsiflexion of foot?

A 25-year-old male while riding the bike met with an accident with his closed fist hitting the ground. He came to the causality complaining of pain in the base of 1st metacarpal. On the x-ray of hand, following fracture pattern was seen. What can be the diagnosis?

A 7-year-old female had a fall on an outstretched hand. She is now unable to move her left elbow. On examination, there is gross swelling, ecchymosis in antecubital fossa, & range of motion is painful & limited. On the lateral view of X-ray of the elbow, the anterior humeral line is not passing through capitellum. This patient has:
A 13-year-old boy had a fall on an outstretched hand. Now, he complains of pain on the lateral side of the elbow. On X-ray, Thurston Holland fragment is seen. What is the diagnosis?

A 9-year-old boy presented with pain in the right hip joint which was tender on palpation, associated with fever (38.3°C). Blood tests showed elevated levels of C-reactive protein and ESR. No pathological findings were found in the X-ray of the hip. Ultrasound of right hip joint showed mild increase in joint space. Pus culture and sensitivity yielded plenty pus cells in pair of chains. Which organism most commonly cause infection in this age group?

A 9-year-old boy presented with pain in right hip joint which was tender on palpation, associated with fever (38.3°C). Pain in his upper right thigh began a day before, which increased on the day of his presentation. Parents also reported that the pain was sudden in onset and there was restriction in movement. Birth history was normal and uneventful. There was no history of trauma. Blood tests showed elevated levels of C-reactive protein and ESR (80 mm/1 hr). Total blood count showed 16.8×10 9 leucocytes/L with a differential of 87% neutrophils and 18% lymphocytes. Haemoglobin was 9.9 g/L and mean cell volume was 72 fL, revealing microcytic anaemia with neutrophilia. Diagnostic criteria used here is:

A 12-year-old male child was presented to the paediatric unit of the secondary care public hospital, with the complaints of pain and swelling in the right leg & pus discharge since 4 months. He had undergone a surgery in the right leg 5 months back in a private hospital due to an accidental fall. Consent was obtained in written form from the patient's caretaker and the data was collected. The boy was found to be underweight (BMI – 16) and the vitals were as follows: pulse rate – 86 beats/min; respiratory rate – 20 breaths/min; and temperature – 98.4°F. The laboratory investigations were total white cell count – 13.3 x 10 9 /L, C-reactive protein – 7.84 mg/L, ESR – 61 mm/h. CT scan showed permeative osteolytic lesion on the proximal right tibia. The MRI report came on the 5 th day which showed chronic osteomyelitis involving upper tibia with sequestrum and pathological fracture of sinus tract. How will you manage this case?

options.label: B
options.text: Surgical drainage, debridement, and antibiotic therapy

questions.correct_answer: B. Surgical drainage, debridement, and antibiotic therapy
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Surgical drainage, debridement, and antibiotic therapy

questions.text: A 35-year-old male presented with slowly progressive swelling in the middle 1/3rd of his right leg and pain in the same region. X-ray of the right leg showed multiple, sharply circumscribed, lucent lesions ("soap bubble" appearance) with interspersed sclerotic bone in the mid tibia. Microscopic examination of the biopsy sample showed islands of epithelial cells in a fibrous stroma. What can be the diagnosis?

A 67-year-old male is experiencing left hemithoracic paresthesia with irradiation to his left arm. There is no h/o trauma. On chest X-ray for pulmonary involvement, an accessory left rib was seen. Cause for paresthesia is_______________.

A 23-year-old female presented with numbness in the middle finger of the left hand with positive tinel test & hand symptom diagram. On further examination, Durkan’s compression test was also found to be positive. The patient is suffering from:

An 11-year-old boy had a history of fracture of medial condyle of humerus 3 years back. Now, he is having paresthesia on medial aspect of forearm and inner aspect of the hand. Which nerve is injured in this case?

A 60-year-old male presented in the OPD with left hand weakness & inability to extend any of his fingers. There was a history of trauma to the posterior elbow. On examination, he was found to have complete claw hand. On EMG, he was found to have involvement of which nerves?

In an engineering school swimming party, a 60-year-old male professor squeezed himself into last year’s bikini bathing suit despite gaining 11kgs over the winter. Following a day of “impressing” his students and colleagues, he noticed numbness, tingling, and a burning sensation on the lateral aspect of his left upper thigh. His symptoms were exacerbated by applying pressure near the left anterior superior iliac spine. Which nerve is most likely affected in this case?

options.label: C
options.text: Anterior cutaneous branches of femoral nerve

questions.text: A 20-year-old female football player suffers a shoulder injury and arrives at the ER 2 hours after the injury. The attending doctor diagnosed shoulder dislocation, and after administration of a local anaesthetic solution, the doctor repositioned the head of the humerus into the glenoid cavity (reduction). No fractures were seen on the X-rays. However, the patient displayed weakness in abduction and external rotation at the shoulder. A loss of sensation was also noted at the superior and lateral aspects of the arm. Which nerve was most likely damaged in this injury?

A 35-year-old man broke a window with his fist to rescue his child from house fire. The man sustained a laceration to the lateral aspect of his right forearm, but he only showed a sensory deficit (numbness and paraesthesia) on the dorsolateral aspect of his hand (as denoted by the shaded area within the given image). Which nerve was most likely damaged?

options.label: A
options.text: Dorsal cutaneous branch of the ulnar nerve

options.label: B
options.text: Lateral cutaneous nerve of the forearm

options.label: C
options.text: Posterior cutaneous nerve of the forearm

options.label: D
options.text: Superficial branch of the radial nerve

questions.correct_answer: D. Superficial branch of the radial nerve
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Superficial branch of the radial nerve

questions.text: A 31-year-old male footballer presented with complaint of left-sided low back ache, gluteal and leg pain that is travelling down into posterior calf since 3–4 months after playing the sport. He stated that the low back pain “came and went”. He identified the left-sided leg pain as constant “dull” and occasional “sharp” type. The aggravating factor was prolonged sitting. The relieving factors included stretching, walking and getting up from sitting. He reported taking no medications or supplements. He recalled a previous incidence of mild back pain without leg pain in high school. The neurological examination was unremarkable in the lower extremities. Gait and heel-toe walking were normal. Positive tests that reproduced his leg and low back pain included Valsalva, left-sided straight leg raise at approximately 45 ° and Bragard’s Sign. Negative tests included right-sided SLR, bilateral Bowstring’s Sign, Thomas test, Patrick/Faber/Distraction test, Thigh thrust test, Gaenslen’s test, Ober’s test, postero-anterior and side SI compression, Ely’s test, Hibb’s test, Yeoman’s test, and Spring/joint mobility tests. What is the diagnosis?

An elderly female was admitted with a fracture neck of right femur which failed to unite. On examination, AVN of head of femur was noted. This condition would have been resulted most probably from the damage to which artery?

options.label: D
options.text: Retinacular branches of circumflex femoral artery

questions.correct_answer: D. Retinacular branches of circumflex femoral artery
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Retinacular branches of circumflex femoral artery

questions.text: A 20-year-old male had an RTA where a car ran over his right leg. On examination, his vitals were stable and the general physical examination was fine. His right leg was crushed with exposure of muscles and bones. The debate about limb survival can be resolved to an extent by using which score?

A 4-year-old child presented in the OPD with right foot being small. On examination, stretched skin on dorsolateral aspect, & creases on medial aspect were seen. The lateral border of the foot was convex & there was medial convexity with furrows. Gait was stumbling type with the child walking on lateral border of the foot. Diagnosis & Method of correction is:

A 16-year-old male presented with a right neglected clubfoot deformity. His family immigrated to the United States two years before. Although the problem was a source of embarrassment, it did not interfere with the patient’s ability to function in normal childhood and adolescent life tasks. Which surgery will you perform?

A 3-year-old male child was brought to the OPD by his parents with complaints of inability to stand or walk. On Examination, it was noted that both hips lied in a flexed and adducted attitude with restricted extension, external rotation and abduction. On x-ray pelvis & both hips, epiphysis of both hips were displaced and lying on the superolateral quadrant formed by intersection of Perkins and Hilgenreiner lines. What is the diagnosis?

A 6-year-old boy was brought to your OPD by his parents with complaint of disability in the child’s left leg. Patient had a minor trauma injury 4 years back. On examination, there is anterolateral angulation of left leg at lower third and middle third junction, shortening by 1 cm and wasting of calf muscles by 2 cms. Patient is having a short limb gait. There is an associated right-sided scoliosis of dorsal spine and café-au-lait spots over the trunk. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 9-year-old male presented in the OPD with a deformity and inability to fully flex his left elbow following an injury to the elbow 3 years back for which he was treated with closed reduction and percutaneous fixation with two T1 wires from the medial side and an above elbow POP slab. On examination, the carrying angle of the left elbow was found to be decreased. This boy is suffering from which deformity?

A 65-year-old female presented in the causality after fall from standing height with complaints of pain in the left hip and an inability to bear weight. On local examination, her leg was slightly externally rotated, abducted & shortened by 1 cm. On x-ray pelvis & both hips, shenton’s line was broken & lesser trochanter was more prominent. Where do you expect the fracture line lies?
Identify the deficiency.
X-ray proximal femur in a patient with pain in hip is given below. The deformity shown is:
Shown below is an X-ray of wrist with a lesion in a 25-year-old female. Identify the same.
